subject: [Gamesnetwork] Correction regarding Call for papers Workshop on Game Intelligence and Informatics (GII)
body:
I am sorry for the multiple emails. I was told the url didn't work, so below is the correct url. Please circulate to all interested researchers Call for Papers Pacific Asia Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (PAKDD) 2020 Workshop on Game Intelligence and Informatics (GII) URL: https://web.northeastern.edu/guii/gii/ Overview The wide proliferation of digital games has necessitated a new research direction towards game intelligence and knowledge discovery. Understanding the game state and player action is a fundamental objective for any game researcher, because it sheds light on various aspects about the players and the game, such as skills, strategies, engagement and intention. Such intelligence helps us advance closer to the holy grail of providing a perfectly personalized and wholesome user experience, in a data-driven manner. The problem space becomes all the more intriguing when we consider niche gaming sectors such as serious games, AR/VR/IoT- enhanced experiential games, esports/fantasy leagues, MMORPG, casino and card games, etc. The GII workshop aims to bring together research that lies at the intersection of machine learning, human computer interaction and digital gaming. Dates Jan 22, 2020 (Submission) Feb 21, 2020 (Notification of acceptance) March 6, 2020 (Camera-Ready Copy) Organizers: Sharanya Eswaran, Games 24x7, India Magy Seif El-Nasr, Northeastern University, US Tridib Mukherjee, Games24x7, India Program Committee: Georgios Yannakakis, University of Malta Santiago Ontan, Drexel University and Google AI Tristan Cazenave, Lamsade, Dauphine Matthew Berland, University of Wisconsin Madison Brent Harrison, University of Kentucky Sam Snodgrass, Modl.ai James Lester, North Carolina State University Guenter Wallner, Eindhoven University of Technology Ruck Thawonmas, Ritsumeikan University Theja Tulabandhula, University of Illinois, Chicago Koyel Mukherjee, IBM Research -- Magy Seif El-Nasr Associate Professor Khoury College of Computer Sciences College of Arts, Media and Design Northeastern University

I am sorry for the multiple emails.

I was told the url didn't work, so below is the correct url.

 

Please circulate to all interested researchers

 

Call for Papers

 

Pacific Asia Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (PAKDD) 2020

 

Workshop  on Game Intelligence and Informatics (GII)

 

URL: https://web.northeastern.edu/guii/gii/

 

Overview

 

The wide proliferation of digital games has necessitated a new research direction towards game intelligence and knowledge discovery. Understanding the game state and player action is a fundamental objective for any game researcher, because it sheds light on various aspects about the players and the game, such as skills, strategies, engagement and intention. Such intelligence helps us advance closer to the holy grail of providing a perfectly personalized and wholesome user experience, in a data-driven manner.  The problem space becomes all the more intriguing when we consider niche gaming sectors such as serious games, AR/VR/IoT- enhanced experiential games, esports/fantasy leagues, MMORPG, casino and card games, etc. The GII workshop aims to bring together research that lies at the intersection of machine learning, human computer interaction and digital gaming.

 

Dates

 

Jan 22, 2020 (Submission)

 

Feb 21, 2020 (Notification of acceptance)

 

March 6, 2020 (Camera-Ready Copy)

 

Organizers:

 

Sharanya Eswaran, Games 24x7, India

 

Magy Seif El-Nasr, Northeastern University, US

 

Tridib Mukherjee, Games24x7, India

 

 

Program Committee:

 

Georgios Yannakakis, University of Malta

 

Santiago Ontan, Drexel University and Google AI

 

Tristan Cazenave, Lamsade, Dauphine

 

Matthew Berland, University of Wisconsin Madison

 

Brent Harrison, University of Kentucky

 

Sam Snodgrass, Modl.ai

 

James Lester, North Carolina State University

 

Guenter Wallner, Eindhoven University of Technology

 

Ruck Thawonmas, Ritsumeikan University

 

Theja Tulabandhula, University of Illinois, Chicago

 

Koyel Mukherjee, IBM Research

 

 

 

-- 

Magy Seif El-Nasr

Associate Professor

Khoury College of Computer Sciences

College of Arts, Media and Design

Northeastern University
